definitions: stage (of a theatre, concert hall, etc.)
monkey (esp. the Japanese macaque, Macaca fuscata)
female usually between 7 and 18 years old
field (for growing wheat, fruit, vegetables, etc.)
rainy season (in Japan usu. from early June to mid-July)
legume (esp. edible legumes or their seeds, e.g. beans, peas, pulses)
local specialty or souvenir bought as a gift while travelling
to be able (in a position) to do
to be up to the task
to take (a resource, e.g. time or money)
one's origin (e.g. city, country, parentage, school)
to close (e.g. book, eyes, meeting, etc.)
activity (of a person, organization, animal, volcano, etc.)
conclusion (of an argument, discussion, study, etc.)
to hold (one's head) in one's hands
of the order of (following a number)
entry (in a form, register, diary, etc.)
to restore (to a previous state, e.g. defrosting, reconstituting, reconciling)
conquest (of a difficulty, illness, handicap, etc.)
to make a long story short
passing through (a tunnel, station, town, etc.)
food (esp. staple food such as rice or wheat)
being in charge (of an area of responsibility)
being responsible (for a work role, etc.)
entering a higher-level school, esp. going on to university
train heading toward the ending point of its route
to put on (lower-body clothing, e.g. pants, skirt, footwear)
to give (esp. to someone of lower status)
to abide by (a rule, custom, etc.)
to keep (a pet or other animal)
to entrust (e.g. a task) to another
to take (seat, position, course, office, etc.)
to lower (a hand, flag, shutter, etc.)
to grow (of hair, height, grass, etc.)
to blow off (e.g. in the wind)
thank you (for the meal just served)
yacht (esp. a sailing boat with one mast)
case (e.g. receptacle, condition, event, legal action, letter style, etc.)
out (of a ball; in tennis, etc.)
continuously in some state (for a long time, distance)
to sink below the surface and become unable to breathe
if you want to know why
to fill (a cup, bowl, etc.) with
pin (e.g. hairpin, bowling pin, golf pin, etc.)
ton (esp. a metric ton, i.e. 1000 kg)
native Japanese reading of a Chinese character
to hold in one's arms (e.g. a baby)
2.4 mm (one-tenth of a mon, a traditional unit used to measure shoe sizes)
0.1 degree (one-tenth of a do, used to measure body temperature on any temperature scale)
destiny (esp. as a mysterious force that binds two people together)
7th in a sequence denoted by the iroha system
